result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Benjamin J Peters

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 1, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

[MK[ cases #22CF219 and #22CF220 called at 9:35am 
Defendant Benjamin J Peters in court with Attorney Joseph Fischer. ADA Krysta Parson in court for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Parson verifies victim rights compliance.
Attorney Fischer indicates that a pretrial conference was held on September 14th, and now the Defense is awaiting a plea-offer. Counsel agree that the scheduling of another status conference is appropriate.
recess 9:38am

NEXT:  Status Conference on December 1st at 2:30pm

Pre-trial conference on September 14, 2022 at 11:40 am.
Status conference on October 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.

[MK] cases #22CF219, #22CF220 called at 8:56am  
Defendant Benjamin J. Peters in court with Attorney Joseph Fischer.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

In Case #22CF220 Prelim-Waiver is held: 
--Mr. Peters waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

In Case #22CF219 Preliminary Hearing is held:  
Officer A. Nell- sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Beck
--cross examination by Attorney Fischer
--redirect examination by ADA Beck
--recross examination by Attorney Fischer
Arguments given by counsel 
The Court finds probable cause that Mr. Peters committed a felony. The Court binds him over for Trial.

Arraignments are held in both cases: 
Service of Informations is admitted; reading is waived; the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Pleas of "not guilty" are entered
In response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate they are not requesting speedy trials.
recess 9:30am 

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on September 14th at 11:40am,  (2) Status Conference on October 6th at 9:30am
Scheduling Order

Pre-trial conference on July 27, 2022 at 02:40 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

[MK] cases #22CF219, #22CF220 called at 9:36am
Defendant Benjamin J Peters in court with Attorney Joseph Fischer.  DA Intern Haley Shelton, supervised by ADA Theresa Beck, appears for the State of Wisconsin 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.
Attorney Fischer requests the scheduling of a pretrial conference. 
recess 9:39am

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on July 27th at 2:40pm,  (2) Preliminary Hearings on August 19th at 8:30am
Atty Fischer

Adjustment Number: 22A 162399,
Payable Number: 193337,
Receipt Number: 22R 012474,
Amount: $20.00
Adjourned initial appearance on July 22, 2022 at 09:15 am.

[ml] Cases 22CF219 and 22CF220 called at 3:02PM
Defendant Benjamin J Peters in court. DA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Upon inquiry from the Court, the Defendant advises that he is awaiting a pending check for a retainer fee. The Defendant advises that he has been in contact with an attorney, and that he should have retained that attorney within two weeks.
The Court continues to toll time limts, and sets this matter over for another Adjourned Initial Appearance in both files so that the Defendant may appear with counsel.

recess 3:04PM

NEXT: Status Conference on 07/22 at 9:15AM
Adjourned initial appearance on July 7, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

[MK] cases #22CF219 and #22CF220 called at 2:35pm 
Defendant Benjamin J Peters in court.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Teuber verifies victim rights compliance. 
In response to the Court's inquiry regarding counsel, Mr. Peters indicates that he is working on getting an attorney; he is seeking a continuance to raise the funds and obtain an attorney.  Mr. Peters indicates that he is employed full-time so he feels that thirty days is enough time for him to raise the funds. 
The Court continues to toll the preliminary hearing time limits.  
Mr. Peters indicates that the 508 College Avenue address remains current. 
recess 2:37pm 

NEXT:  Status Conference [JA- also schedule cases for AIA] on  July 7th at 3:00pm
Status conference on May 23, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Bond payment and surety information
Status conference on May 12, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
to cover both 22CF219 & 22CF220
Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case
The Court requires a single $10,000 CASH or Surety Bond to cover both 22CF219 & 22CF220 with conditions

[ma] Cases 22CF219 & 22CF220 called at 1:33 PM 
Defendant Benjamin J Peters appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Jeffrey De La Rosa (PD appears for bond-purposes only--Mr. Peters may retain private counsel).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

Right to Counsel reviewed
The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court will toll preliminary hearing time limits

Bond Arguments given by Counsel

Atty De La Rosa asserts that Mr. Peters may have equity in a home, requests a surety bond be allowed.

The Court requires a single $10,000 CASH or Surety Bond to cover both 22CF219 & 22CF220 with conditions:
--no acts or threats of violence
--no contact with Victim 1
--not to direct any 3rd party to have contact with Victim 1
--maintain absolute sobriety
--no possession of dangerous weapons to include firearms 

recess 1:49  pm.
